intro: Oliveriana chocoana, commonly known as the Chocoan mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the rainforests of Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white flowers. The plant attaches itself to the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients through its haustoria. It plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for certain birds and insects. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to survive.
